question:
Solve the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 2y & - & 3z & + & w & = & -2 \\
3x & - & y & - & 2z & - & 4w & = & 1 \\
2x & + & 3y & - & 5z & + & w & = & -3 \\
x & + & y & - & z & + & w & = & -2
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(z+w,\,z-w-1,\,z,\,w\right)$ as solution for all $z,w\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,2,\,2,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(x,\,y,\,x+y,\,x-y-1\right)$ as solution for all $x,y\in\mathbb{R}$.

question: Indicate which of the following polynomials span $P_2=\{a_2x^2+a_1x+a_0, a_2,a_1,a_0 \in \mathbb{R}\}$.

\[\begin{array}{ll}	
\text{Maximize} & Z= 3x_{1}+x_{2}+4x_{3}\\
\text{subject to} & 6x_{1}+3x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 25 \text{ (resource 1)}\\
& 3x_{1}+4x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 20 \text{ (resource 2)}\\
& x_{1}, x_{2}, x_{3}\geq 0\\ 
\end{array}
\]

Suppose that the only change in the original problem is that new variable $x_{new}$ has been introduced into the model as follows:

\[\begin{array}{ll}	
\text{Maximize} & Z= 3x_{1}+x_{2}+4x_{3}+2x_{new}\\
\text{subject to} & 6x_{1}+3x_{2}+5x_{3}+3x_{new} \leq 25 \text{ (resource 1)}\\
& 3x_{1}+4x_{2}+5x_{3}+2x_{new} \leq 20 \text{ (resource 2)}\\
& x_{1}, x_{2}, x_{3}, x_{new} \geq 0\\ 
\end{array}
\]

question: Assume that $u$, $v$ and $w$ are vectors in $\mathbb{R}^4$ linearly independent. Choose the right answer.
answer3: The null vector cannot be written as a linear combination of $u$, $v$ and $w$
answer4: If $t\in \mathbb{R}^4$ then $t$ can be written as a linear combination of $u$, $v$ and $w$

question: Choose the right answer:
answer1: The rotation function  $F_\theta:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated with the  $\theta$ angle is an orthogonal linear operator
answer2: The translation function $F_v:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated to vector $v$ is a linear operator
answer3: The reflection function $F:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ around the line y = x, defined by $F(x,y)=(y, x)$ is a non-orthogonal linear operator
answer4: The rotation function  $F_\theta:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated with the  $\theta$ angle is a non-orthogonal linear operator

u(x,y)=x\sin (y)$ and $v(x,y)=x\cos (y)$.

answer3: $A$ is linearly independent but $B$ is not

Consider the linear operator $F:\mathbb{R}^2 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ such that $F(x,y)=(x+2y,2x+3y)$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(-3x+2y, 2x-y)$
answer3: $F^{-1}$ is defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, -2x+y)$ and is not a symmetric operator

question:
Consider the table

$$\begin{array}{c|ccc}
x & 1 & 2 & 3   \\
\hline
y & 42 & 42.4 & 42.7 \\
\end{array} $$ 

Using Newton's polynomial, find the value of $P(1.5)$.

Solve the linear system
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\
3x & - & y & - & z & = & 4 \\
x & + & 5y & + & 5z & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(0,\,0,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(x,\,x,\,-2x+1\right)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(\frac{5}{4},\,y,\,z\right)$ as solution for every $y,z\in\mathbb{R}$.

-30x_1+180x_2-60x_3  & = & 400 \\

Find the solutions $\left(\text{in } \mathbb{C}^2\right)$ of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
(1+i)z& + & (1-i)w & = & i \\
(1-i)z& + & (1+i)w & = & 1-i
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The unique solution of the linear system is $\bigg(\frac{3+i}{4},-\frac{1+i}{4}\bigg)$.
answer2: The solutions of the linear system are of the form $\bigg(\frac{1+i}{4},\frac{-1+i}{4}+z\bigg)$, for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.
answer3: The linear system has no solutions.
answer4: The linear system has the vector $(i,-i)$ has its unique solution.

question:
Find the solution of the following linear system: 
$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &5 \\
&5x &+ &3y &+ &2z &= &0 \\
& & &y &- &z &= &0
\end{cases}$$

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
6x & - & 11y & + & 2z & - & 9t & = & 2 \\
2x & + & y & - & 2z & - & t & = & 1 \\
x & - & 3y & + & z & - & 2t & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(0,\,1,\,0,\,-1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(1+z,\,0,\,z,\,-z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(1-y,\,y,\,2+y,\,-y\right)$ as solution for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.

question: Consider the transformations $T:\cal{M}_{2\times 2}(\mathbb{R})\longrightarrow \mathbb{R}$. Mark the linear transformation.

Medical researchers analyze how different dosages of a drug affect the duration of relief from allergic symptoms. They want to develop a statistical model to predict the time of relief (in days) based on the dosage of a new drug. Identify the predictor variable and the response variable.
answer1: The predictor variable is a dosage of a new drug; the response variable is the time of relief.
answer2: The predictor variable is the time of relief; the response variable is the dosage of the new drug.
answer3: The predictor variable is the mean of time of relief; the response variable is the mean of dosage of the new drug.
answer4: The predictor variable is the mean of dosage of a new drug; the response variable is the mean of time of relief.

question: Consider the vectors $u=(-1, 2, 3)$ and $v=(0, 1, 1)$ of $\mathbb{R}^3$. The cross product $u\times v$ is:
answer1: A vector that is normal to the plane containing $u$ and $v$ with norm $\sqrt{3}$.
answer2: A vector parallel to $u$ and $v$ with norm $\sqrt{3}$.
answer3: A vector that is perpendicular to both $u$ and $v$ with norm $2\sqrt{7}$ .
answer4: A vector parallel to $u$ and $v$ with norm $2\sqrt{7}$.

question: Differentiate $\displaystyle{y=3e^x-2^x+4x^2}$.
Find the derivative function of $y=e^{-x} \sin(3x)$.

Letting $j := e^{\frac{2i\pi}{3}}$, find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the values of the parameters $a,b\in\mathbb{C}$:
$$\begin{cases}
x & - & y & - & z & = & 0 \\ 
x & + & jy & + & j^{2}z & = & a \\ 
 &  & j^{2}y & + & jz & = & b
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has no solutions if $a+b\neq 0$. 

If $b=-a$, then for every $a\in\mathbb{C}$ the system has $\left(\frac{a+(1+2j)z}{1+j},\,\frac{a+jz}{1+j},\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.
answer2: The system has no solution for every value of $a$ and $b$.
answer3: The system has $\left(0,0,0\right)$ as its unique solution if $a=b=0$, and for all other values of $a$ and $b$ the system has no solutions.
answer4: For every $a,b\in\mathbb{C}$ the system has $\left(\frac{a+(1+2j)z}{1+j},\,\frac{a+jz}{1+j},\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
6x & - & 11y & + & 2z & - & 9t & = & 2 \\
2x & + & y & - & 2z & - & t & = & 1 \\
x & - & 3y & + & z & - & 2t & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(0,\,1,\,0,\,-1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(1+z,\,0,\,z,\,-z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(1-y,\,y,\,2+y,\,-y\right)$ as solution for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:

&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\
&-x &+ &3y &+ &2z &= &-1 \\

\end{cases}$$
answer3: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter.
answer4: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameters.

Find the partial derivatives of the function $z(x,y)=x^4 e^{y^5}$.
answer1: $\dfrac{\partial z}{\partial x}(x,y)=4x^3 e^{y^5}, \dfrac{\partial z}{\partial y}(x,y)=5x^4y^4 e^{y^5} $
answer2: $\dfrac{\partial z}{\partial x}(x,y)=4x^5 e^{y^4}, \dfrac{\partial z}{\partial y}(x,y)=x^4 e^{y^5} y^4$
answer3: $\dfrac{\partial z}{\partial x}(x,y)=3x^3 e^{y^5}, \dfrac{\partial z}{\partial y}(x,y)=x^4 e^{y^5} 5y$
answer4: $\dfrac{\partial z}{\partial x}(x,y)=x^3 e^{y^5}, \dfrac{\partial z}{\partial y}(x,y)=x^4 e^{y} 5y^4$

question:
Consider the linear applications 

$\begin{array}{cccc}
F: & \mathbb{R}^3 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y, z) & \longrightarrow & (y, x-z)
\end{array}$
$\begin{array}{cccc}
G: & \mathbb{R}^2 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y) & \longrightarrow & (x+y, x-2y)
\end{array}$

Choose the right answer:
answer1: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)$ does not exist
answer2: $(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$and $(G\circ F)$ does not exist
answer3: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$
answer4: $(G\circ F)(y, x-z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)(x, y)=(x+y, x-2y)$

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
2x & + & y & - & 4z & = & 0 \\
-x & + & y & + & z & = & 0 \\
x & + & 5y & - & 5z & = & 0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The solutions of the system are $\left(\frac{5}{2}y,\,y,\,\frac{3}{2}y\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(5,2,3\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(0,\,0,\,0\right)$ as its unique solution.
